owner.username: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

description._content: Greek migrants arriving at (possibly) Bremerhaven from Camp Lesum prior to embarking on the FAIRSEA, August 1953. Notices on wall at back read, from left to right: `?Lessen sie ihr gepack reisenbehnemflich abfertigen have your baggage registered to final destination' [2].`Abfertigung von frachtgut u. Eilgut'. [3]. As for [1]. An inscription on the reverse reads: `Greek migrants arriving from Camp Lesum prior to embarking on FAIRSEA 6.8.1953.' In the lower right corner is a black ink stamp reading: 'ICEM photograph no.450...' (Intergovernmental Committee for European Migration) The ANMM undertakes research and accepts public comments that enhance the information we hold about images in our collection. Object no. ANMS0214[108] The Australian National Maritime Museum will be holding an after-dark lightshow based on stories of migration from 26 January to 17 February 2013. Check the website for more information on 'Waves of Migration', and how you can tell share your migration story.
